sub_topic: Moduli spaces of algebraic curves and their properties
message_1: Let X be a smooth projective curve of genus 3. Determine the dimension of the moduli space M_g of algebraic curves that are birational to X.
message_2:
The moduli space M_g is the space of isomorphism classes of smooth projective curves of genus g. In this case, g = 3. To determine the dimension of M_g, we can use the formula:

dim(M_g) = 3g - 3

where g is the genus of the curve. Plugging in the value of g, we get:

dim(M_3) = 3(3) - 3 = 9 - 3 = 6

So, the dimension of the moduli space M_3 of algebraic curves that are birational to X is 6.
